description:
Doesn't work. Opens a black empty window. Apparently only is supposed to open YouTube Music; meaning no local music.
-KDE Plasma Steamdeck Linux.
The dark theme and media key controls are a real improvement over just using chromium --app.
Google play music app integrates as well as you would expect from the google service.  Much appreciated
Really appreciate the development of this app. If there's one suggestion, I'd appreciate if a .desktop file was included in the flatpak installation to integrate into GNOME automatically.
summary: Great app, good features, love dark theme

description: Much better than having a chrome/firefox tab open all the time :D

Used to be great, doesn't work anymore after google music restructure.
Google changed to use google play in conjunction with youtube music - rendering this client useless. Doesn't work for me anymore. Was a good app though. RIP
summary: Used to be great, doesn't work anymore after google music restructure

description:
It seasm this is abandoned!

Not ever their website works and it never changes to google music.

its a great app, just need the lyrics option.


i prefer more Google music than Youtube Music, its user friendly, they should move all the options to just only one.
I know it's just an Electron wrapper but it works very well and the theming options are nice.
Google doesn't allow me to sign in because it considers the browser to be insecure.
summary: It doesn't let me sign in

description: I'm trying to move to Google Music from Spotify, to generally reduce subscription spend. Having this local client to spare me a Chrome window being open all the time was nice in and of itself, but being able to Chromecast from the player was a great surprise. I'm not usually a Chrome user, so it's especially appreciated.

Feels like this app belongs on the system I'm using it on. This should be the standard that apps should follow when porting applications to linux from other systems. It has all the features of the original app while providing the value add of custom themes and settings to integrate with slack and discord without much work. Thanks for making such an amazing application.
summary: E X C E L L E N T

description:
The app was a superior to browsers and other ways how to play Google Music, but with transition to YT music, the app has a limited support and doesn't integrate with GNOME shell anymore as well as it did. 

I recommend looking elsewhere
summary: Used to be great, but fell behind
